blog.name: wake-up-and-smell-the-murder
blog.title: Hello
blog.description: Just your average blog I guess: You know full of Destiel trash and random crap

tags: a currently complete list as of december 2018
summary: A definitive ranking of Marvel movies as at December 2018, from least favourite to most favourite
title: A definitive ranking of Marvel movies as at December 2018, from least favourite to most favourite
body:
Because why not?

Disclaimer – if something is low on the list it doesn’t necessarily mean I think it’s a bad movie - it’s just not one of my favourites.

20. The Incredible Hulk

What can I even say about this?  I’ve seen it once.  I remember next to nothing about it.  Liv Tyler is in it, I’m pretty sure.

It’s not as bad as the Ang Lee version though, so there’s that.

19.  Doctor Strange

This isn’t a bad movie, but I just don’t really enjoy it.  I have no real inclination to ever watch it again (but I will, because I think I’ll do a complete re-watch from start to Endgame once I have them all on DVD).

I don’t like an origin story, is the thing we’ll take away from this list.  Origin stories are boring.

18.  Thor: The Dark World

It pains me to put Thor so far down on this list but in looking at the Marvel movies, I realise that I like almost everything more than this movie.  Sorry, Thor.

I don’t think this is quite so bad as people say – it has its moments – but I’m really glad they re-directed with Ragnarok, because Hemsworth deserves better.

17. Ant-Man

Sorry, Paul Rudd.

16.  Black Panther

M'Baku love aside (I LOVE YOU M'BAKU), this isn’t one of my favourites, mostly due to the fact that it’s a) an origin story, and b) has a villain that I just hate with a blinding rage.

15. Captain America: The First Avenger

Origin stories are SO BORING.

But – Peggy is the best, and I will always love Cap.

14. Iron Man 2

I like this movie, but in terms of re-watchability, it’s not high on my list.  I’ve always liked the bit on the racetrack with the electric whips and Tony completely bewildered.

I don’t think this is quite as bad as what some reviews say – I like it, but if I’m going to re-watch an Iron Man movie, it’s going to be the first one.  Even though it’s an origin story!

13. Iron Man 3

Ditto what I said about IM2, though I do love when Pepper goes full badass at the end.  Also, it has Guy Pearce, so… you know.  Obviously, it’s better than IM2.

12.  Captain America: Civil War

It was on re-watching and reviewing this movie this year that I realised just how much it frustrates me – like, I think you’re supposed to be on Cap’s side, but I’m very much team Tony?  Even after my friend and I saw it at the movies we were team Tony.

And yes, I get that signing the accords is a bit short-sighted and stupid, but like… Cap is a total fucking dick.  Bucky, as the Winter Soldier, murdered Tony’s parents.  You expect him to just be cool with that?  Come on, dude.  I’m sorry, I know he was brainwashed, but he MURDERED TONY’S PARENTS.  THAT IS NOT SOMETHING YOU JUST FORGIVE AND FORGET.

This is also brought down by the fact that Cap kisses fucking bland ass boring bland boring fucking BORING blonde agent lady, like NOBODY NEEDED THAT SHOEHORNED IN ROMANCE THAT NOBODY CARES ABOUT. Blonde boring agent lady can go get fucked.

Despite that, the airport scene remains the best, and I remain Team Tony, always and forever.

11. Captain America:  The Winter Soldier

There are a few moments that stand out for me in this movie – the elevator scene, the buildings collapsing at the end, and Cap and Natasha being on the run together, but ultimately, it’s middle of the road for me.  I like my superhero movies with a dash more humour.

10. Ant-Man & the Wasp

I enjoyed this way more than the first Ant-Man. I loved how they expanded Evangeline Lilly’s part, I love Scott, and I love how zany and fun it was after Infinity War.

9.  Avengers: Age of Ultron

I realise this is one of the lower ranked Marvel movies but I enjoy it – but then again, often times I do enjoy the “bad” movies more than the “good” movies.  Yeah, it’s kind of shitty that Tony and Bruce kind of inflict this upon themselves, but I’m not mad at it.  Honestly, I could easily re-watch this one.  On the whole, the Avengers movies (aside from Thor) are my favourites in the MCU.

8. Iron Man

I remember when this first came out and me thinking, “Who the fuck is Iron Man, this is going to suck, ugh I suppose I’ll watch it, it’ll just be a big dumb popcorn movie, who cares,” and then being like… huh.  I humbly admit that I was wrong.

It still stands in my top 10 and I think it’s one of the best Marvel movies, and also, not sure if I have mentioned this, but I fucking love Tony Stark.

7. Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2.

Volumes 1 & 2 go hand in hand for me, but I like Vol. 1 just that little bit more – possibly because it felt so goddamn fresh when it came out.  They’re both good, solid, funny Marvel movies.  I maybe don’t care so much about Yondu’s death (he was kind of a villain for most of the time and then they send him off like a hero and I’m like… okay?), but this movie has Kurt Russell, and god damn it do I love me some Kurt Russell.

6. Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 1.

A great movie, from the casting to the soundtrack to the visual effects – everything about it is spot on.  I didn’t go to the movies for years (in my defence, going to the movies can be quite expensive), but I broke the drought to go see GOTG.

5. Spider-Man: Homecoming

If I’m honest, I have big Spider-Man fatigue, unless it’s Tom Holland playing Spider-Man.  There have just been too many versions of the same thing at this point that I find it really, really difficult to get excited about a character that I’m just not excited about at all (see the latest animated Spider-Man, even though it’s getting great reviews, I just cannot muster up any enthusiasm for it at all).

So I was not expecting to enjoy this movie as much as I did, nor did I ever think it would be in my top 5, but I would consider it a feel-good Marvel movie – the stakes are lower, the cast is likeable, it has Michael Keaton – like, it’s a fucking good movie.  And honestly, I’m pretty sure if anyone but Tom Holland had played Spider-Man, it wouldn’t be top 10.

 4. Thor

Look, an origin story makes the top 5!  I love this movie.  I remember distinctly how happy it made me the first time I saw it, and for me, it’s endlessly rewatchable.  Thor wasn’t always dreary and serious, the movie is goofy and fun and I love it.

3. Avengers: Infinity War

I’ve watched this a fair bit since I first saw it in the cinemas.  I really, really love this movie.  I know movies like these will never get a (fair) look in as a serious awards contender, but I really think this movie is an achievement in itself – it’s never boring, it’s beautiful to look at, and all of our favourite characters are there.  Sure, Thanos is a dick, but when Endgame comes out, I very much look forward to the resolution of his storyline, and hopefully, the chopping off of his head.

 2. The Avengers

Fucking love this movie.  It would be no. 1 if not for Ragnarok.  It was my favourite Marvel movie for a hell of a long time. Everything about it is great, but I especially love the big New York battle scene at the end.

1. Thor: Ragnarok

If anything else was no. 1, you guys would’ve thought I was mental.  I knew I was going to love this with all of my heart when I first saw the trailer – I have not been so excited to see a Marvel movie before this one.  I love that they fixed Thor’s character; I love that Jeff Goldblum was in the cast; I loved all the nods to Australia and New Zealand – I love this movie.  It’s my go-to Marvel feel good movie that just makes me laugh.  It’s perfect.

Look, an origin story makes the top 5!  I love this movie.  I remember distinctly how happy it made me the first time I saw it, and for me, it’s endlessly rewatchable.  Thor wasn’t always dreary and serious, the movie is goofy and fun and I love it.

3. Avengers: Infinity War

I’ve watched this a fair bit since I first saw it in the cinemas.  I really, really love this movie.  I know movies like these will never get a (fair) look in as a serious awards contender, but I really think this movie is an achievement in itself – it’s never boring, it’s beautiful to look at, and all of our favourite characters are there.  Sure, Thanos is a dick, but when Endgame comes out, I very much look forward to the resolution of his storyline, and hopefully, the chopping off of his head.

 2. The Avengers

Fucking love this movie.  It would be no. 1 if not for Ragnarok.  It was my favourite Marvel movie for a hell of a long time. Everything about it is great, but I especially love the big New York battle scene at the end.

1. Thor: Ragnarok

If anything else was no. 1, you guys would’ve thought I was mental.  I knew I was going to love this with all of my heart when I first saw the trailer – I have not been so excited to see a Marvel movie before this one.  I love that they fixed Thor’s character; I love that Jeff Goldblum was in the cast; I loved all the nods to Australia and New Zealand – I love this movie.  It’s my go-to Marvel feel good movie that just makes me laugh.  It’s perfect.

title: Steve is a Gryffindor
body: I saw a post or two a while back that said Steve Rogers was a Slytherin because he completely ignored the rules and tried to enlist, but I think he’s a Gryffindor.  He didn’t try to join the army under falsified documents because he was ambitious or it was his goal; he tried to join the army because he doesn’t like bullies and he doesn’t care where they’re from.

reblog.comment: I saw a post or two a while back that said Steve Rogers was a Slytherin because he completely ignored the rules and tried to enlist, but I think he’s a Gryffindor.  He didn’t try to join the army under falsified documents because he was ambitious or it was his goal; he tried to join the army because he doesn’t like bullies and he doesn’t care where they’re from.

tags: Tom Holland x Gender Neutral Reader
Tom holland x best friend! reader
body:
Christmas Snow

Tom Holland x Reader

AN: A really short story that I thought of to get yall in the Christmas Spirit.

Warnings: Unedited and made at 11 PM, Swearing, Fluff, Really Short Sorry

“Y/N/N”

“Get up Y/N”

You slowly opened your eyes and closed them agian when you saw the time on your alarm clock . It was four in the morning on Christmas Eve Eve, aka the 23rd. What non-insane person would be up this early during winter break.

“Y/N, get your ass out of bed!”

You finally looked at your early morning tormenter. It was Tom, of course. He is crazy so that would explain why he was up at four in the fucking morning! The Hollands, Osterfields, and Y/L/Ns were all spending the christmas season together at your house. But that still did not explaing why your bestfriend was up so early and forcing you out of your well deserved beauty sleep.

“Thomas Stanley Holland, why the hell are you up at four in the fucking morning. Actually the better question is why are you waking me up at four in the fucking morning,” You said.

Tom laughed and said, “I have a suprise for you asshole, come with me. Put a jacket on first though.”

“Why is my friend such a maniac,” You thought to yourself as you pulled yourself out of bed. Tom stopped outside of your room, and waited for you to get ready. You pulled yourself to your closet and put your coat and slippers on.

“Hurry up Y/N, your taking 50 freaking minutes to put on a coat,” Tom said to you.

“Shut up. When you wake me up at four in the morning, I get to take my time while putting on a coat” you replied.

Tom rolled his eyes and took your hand, and led you to your back door. When your friend opened the door you gasped in excitement.

The covered porch of your backyard was lit up in Christmas lights. On the porch was an air mattress that looked out into the snow covered town. Millions of blankets were stacked on the chair next to the mattress. And there was hot chocolate and your favorite christmas song playing.

“You like it?” Tom asked.

Unable to find words for how much you loved it, you nodded your head while mouth wide open. Tom chuckled and pulled you in his arms.

“Thank you so much, this is amazing,” you told him.

He smiled and said, “Of course , Merry Christmas Eve Eve.”

You laughed and jumped on the air mattress. Tom brought blanckets over and the two of you curled up on the small bed.

“I know how much you love snow and, you haven’t had time to just look out at it this year. So I wanted you to get your yearly alone time with snow before Christmas,” Tom said, “If you want to be all alone I can go.”

You smiled at your best friend and said, “You being here makes it ten times better. Thank you so much Tommy.”

He smiled and curled closer to you. You looked out onto the beautiful town and finally felt a little more into the Christmas spirit. Tom was right, you hadn't  had time for yourself lately and you have missed out on one of your favorite things. Watching the snow.

title: Spider-Man - Hunt For The Amulet
body:
Tony sends Peter on a mission to Rio De Janeiro to find and recruit a girl named Ava Ayala. But when he gets there, a lot of trouble happens when a power-hungry hunter is after her as well. Follows the MCU Timeline. Takes place a month after The Clash of The Avengers.

New Mission

(Peter’s POV)“Ned…Ned, you there buddy?"I say lightly patting my friend on the cheek."I had a crazy dream,” he groaned,“ We were at your house and Tony Stark was there.” He must’ve been so shocked…

Read more…

My migraine thought process

Me: has major head migraine

Me: think abt whats going through. He much worse off, and he’s be fine-ish and will survive…

pessimistic side of my brain: actually he might not

Me: Lol, we’re both gonna die!

tags: you know tony's a little shit at avengers meetings
I bet they're like Gilmore Girls town meetings
summary: Tony: Can I be excused? Fury: The meeting just started and you only just got here! Tony: OK, fair enough. *Waits a beat*...So...
body:
Tony: Can I be excused?

Fury: The meeting just started and you only just got here!

Tony: OK, fair enough. *Waits a beat*…So how bout now? Can I be excused now?
